```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
rm(list = ls())
if (!require(devtools)){
    install.packages('devtools')
}
devtools::install_github('progenetix/pgxRpi')
library(pgxRpi)
```


#Glioblastoma (NCIT:C3058)
```{r}
freq <- pgxLoader(type='frequency', output='pgxseg',filters='NCIT:C3058',
                  codematches=T)
```

```{r}
pgxFreqplot(freq)
```

```{r}
pgxFreqplot(freq, chrom = 9)
```

# I find gians in 7, 19, 20
# and losses in 6, 10 and 9p
# that is similar to what was found by [McNulty et. al 2019](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0046817718304970))
